##Objectives:
The objectives of this exercise are to construct a species distribution model of saguro cactus (*Carnegiea gigantea*) using the bioclim approach, and then visualize precided distribution on a map.

##Methods:

###Species information:
Saguro is arborescent cactus species native to the Sonora dessert in Arizona. These cacti have a very long lifespan, usually exceeding 150 years.

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
ARIMA_model <- tibble::tribble(
      ~Model,                ~Parameter,    ~N,   ~AIC,
"arima.nee1",                        "NEE",  9, 703.09,
"arima.nee2",    "NEE w/ corrected values", 18, 704.77,
"arima.nee3",               "Max salinity", 12, 706.19,
"arima.nee4", "Extreme salinity (>25 ppt)",  9, 700.57,
"arima.nee5",                        "PAR",  9, 683.68
  )

require(knitr)
kable(ARIMA_model, digits = 3, row.names = FALSE, align = "c",
              caption = "*Table 1: Potential ARIMA models and respective model parameters, N value, and AIC value.*")
```
